devdoc.details: Public functions calling external contracts do not guard against reentrancy because they are expected to be called via delegatecall, which will execute this contract's logic within the context of the originating contract. For example, the HubPool will delegatecall these functions, therefore its only neccessary that the HubPool's methods that call this contract's logic guard against reentrancy.

params.target: Contract on Optimism that will receive message.

params.amount: Amount of L1 tokens to deposit and L2 tokens to receive.

relayMessage(address,bytes).notice: Send cross-chain message to target on Optimism.

userdoc.notice: Contract containing logic to send messages from L1 to Optimism.
